p: Following sample extraction and elution in 50 μL, 2–4 μL of converted nucleic acids material were added to the combined PCR mastermix and components using the EasyScreen Flavivirus Dengue Alphavirus Detection Kit. (Genetic Signatures, Sydney, Australia). Thermocycling consisted of 1 cycle of reverse transcription at 42°C for 30 minutes, followed by Taq polymerase activation at 95°C for 15 minutes, then 50 cycles of amplification at 95°C for 2 seconds, 55°C for 15 seconds (data collection), 60°C for 15 seconds and 65°C for 15 seconds. PCR amplification was carried out using either the Biorad CFX96/384 (Biorad, Hercules, USA) or the MIC (Biomolecular Systems, Sydney, Australia) platforms.
